examples: This adds a bit of complexity as it means that our solution should not retrain for every request coming in but be able to determine whether a retrain is worth it for a given request or whether the model is already up to date.

verbs.description: retrain (third-person singular simple present retrains, present participle retraining, simple past and past participle retrained)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To train again; especially, to train or study in a new subject or job
